original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Thorns and snares are the way of the crocked ; Whoever_

_guards his soul will keep far from them. _(Pro. 22:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Thorns and snares were often placed on paths to capture

animals even people, Here thorns and snares refer to the

problems that result from sin.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I pray for Your guidance so that I will be able to

avoid the snares of this world. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Thorns and snares were often placed on paths to capture animals even people, Here thorns and snares refer to the problems that result from sin.
original_verse_text: Thorns and snares are the way of the crocked; Whoever guards his soul will keep far from them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your guidance and protection. Your word in Proverbs warns us of the thorns and snares that lie along the path of the wicked. Grant us the wisdom to turn away from the ways of evil and to walk steadfastly in the light of Your truth. May our steps be firmly planted on the road of righteousness, that we may avoid the pitfalls of sin and find the peace and joy that come from following Your will. We trust in Your loving care and ask that You lead us safely through the challenges of this world. Amen.
reflection: Thorns and snares were often placed on paths to capture animals even people, Here thorns and snares refer to the problems that result from sin.
subject: Overcoming Thorns and Snares
verse_text: Thorns and snares are the way of the crocked; Whoever guards his soul will keep far from them.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Train up a child in the way he should go, and even when he_

_is old he will not depart from it__. _(Pro. 22:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Gospel is the chief teaching of God's Word. We

must hold the commandments before our children, and

constantly teach them so that we bring them up not only

with punishment, but also in reverence and the fear of God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word which

helps us how to teach our children, but is also a guide in

which we need to live our lives so that WE will become a

living Gospel. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Gospel is the chief teaching of God's Word. We must hold the commandments before our children, and constantly teach them so that we bring them up not only with punishment, but also in reverence and the fear of God.
original_verse_text: Train up a child in the way he should go, and even when he is old he will not depart from it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the wisdom of Your Word, which instructs us to raise our children in the way they should go. Help us, as parents, to diligently teach Your commandments and the gospel message to our little ones, that they may grow in reverence and the fear of the Lord. May our homes be filled with Your presence, and may our children come to know and love You. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: The gospel is the chief teaching of God's Word. We must hold the commandments before our children and constantly teach them so that we bring them up not only with punishment but also in reverence and the fear of God.
subject: Teach Children God's Commandments
verse_text: Train up a child in the way he should go, and even when he is old he will not depart from it.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Whoever has a bountiful eye will be blessed,_

_for he shares his bread with the poor. _(Pro. 22:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Works and troubles do not merit justification, but other

payments. The fulfilling of the law eanrs a reward, for

a reward properly relates to the law.Yet we should be

mindful of the Gospel, which freely offers justification

for Christ's sake we neither obey the Law, nor can we

keep it, nor can we obey it, before we have been reconciled

to God, justified, and reborn. Nor would the fulfilling of the

Law please God. We are accepted by faith.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord open and widen our narrow hearts to You,

Your children, and to all. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Works and troubles do not merit justification, but other payments. The fulfilling of the law eanrs a reward, for a reward properly relates to the law. Yet we should be mindful of the Gospel, which freely offers justification for Christ's sake we neither obey the Law, nor can we keep it, nor can we obey it, before we have been reconciled to God, justified, and reborn. Nor would the fulfilling of the Law please God. We are accepted by faith.
original_verse_text: Whoever has a bountiful eye will be blessed, for he shares his bread with the poor.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our works and efforts cannot earn the justification we so desperately need. We recognize that the law, though good, cannot save us, for we are unable to keep it perfectly. Yet, in Your great love, You have freely offered us justification through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ. We give thanks that we are accepted by faith, not by our own merit. Lord, help us to walk in the light of Your Gospel, trusting in Your grace and not our own strength. Amen.
reflection: Works and troubles do not merit justification, but other payments. The fulfilling of the law earns a reward, for a reward properly relates to the law. Yet we should be mindful of the Gospel, which freely offers justification for Christ's sake. We neither obey the Law, nor can we keep it, nor can we obey it, before we have been reconciled to God, justified, and reborn. Nor would the fulfilling of the Law please God. We are accepted by faith.
subject: Justified by Faith, Not Works
verse_text: Whoever has a bountiful eye will be blessed, for he shares his bread with the poor.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_He who loves purity of heart, and whose speech is _

_gracious, will have the king as his friend. _(Prov. 22:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Lord looks with favor on the faithful in the land;

they may dwell with Him. They who walk in the way

of the blameless shall mister to Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, we pray that you would come to us,

and make us people of integrity in Your Church and in Your

nation. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Lord looks with favor on the faithful in the land; they may dwell with Him. They who walk in the way of the blameless shall mister to Him.
original_verse_text: He who loves purity of heart, and whose speech is gracious, will have the king as his friend.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for your steadfast love and favor upon those who walk uprightly before you. May we ever seek to dwell in your presence, delighting in the way of righteousness and finding our joy in serving you. Guide us, Lord, that we may know the blessings you have promised to those who trust in you. In your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The Lord looks with favor on the faithful in the land; they may dwell with Him. They who walk in the way of the blameless shall minister to Him.
subject: Faithful Dwell with the Lord
verse_text: He who loves purity of heart, and whose speech is gracious, will have the king as his friend.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The eyes of the Lord keep watch over knowledge,but _

_He overthrows the words of the traitor. _(Pro. 22:12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_(KNOWLEDGE)_ Human beings cannot always discern the truth

of the situation, but God knows all things He _(OVERTHROWS THE_

_ WORDS OF THE TRAITOR). _God makes sure that those who would

lie to or betray their neighbor will not succeed in the end.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that You know all things.

It makes me feel more secure as I work to serve You. I thank

you that it is by Your grace I can do what I do. Amen.
original_reflection_text: (KNOWLEDGE) Human beings cannot always discern the truth of the situation, but God knows all things He (OVERTHROWS THE WORDS OF THE TRAITOR). God makes sure that those who would lie to or betray their neighbor will not succeed in the end.
original_verse_text: The eyes of the Lord keep watch over knowledge, but He overthrows the words of the traitor.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that our understanding is limited, but You know all things. We thank You that You see the deception and treachery of those who would seek to betray their neighbors. Lord, we ask that You would overthrow the words of the traitor and ensure that their schemes do not succeed. May Your justice and truth prevail, for You are the righteous Judge. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: (KNOWLEDGE) Human beings cannot always discern the truth of the situation, but God knows all things. He (OVERTHROWS THE WORDS OF THE TRAITOR). God makes sure that those who would lie to or betray their neighbor will not succeed in the end.
subject: Unmasking the Traitor's Lies
verse_text: The eyes of the Lord keep watch over knowledge, but He overthrows the words of the traitor.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline
_

_drives it far from him. _(Pro. 22:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"Heart of a child" _I think many tend to think of children as
morally

neutral at worst. BUT THE Bible does not; it says we are born with a

sinful nature. Godly education means not merely bringing the child's

good talents to light but also driving out the bad. The Bible does
approve

of corporal punishment. HOWEVER. it does not envision the sort of
abuse

that would maim, or kill a child, BUT rather it promotes discipline
that

instructs.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for those poor children who have had to

live in conditions which will only cause to another generation of

abused children. Its only by Your grace that this can be discontinued

Amen.
original_reflection_text: "Heart of a child" I think many tend to think of children as morally neutral at worst. BUT THE Bible does not; it says we are born with a sinful nature. Godly education means not merely bringing the child's good talents to light but also driving out the bad. The Bible does approve of corporal punishment. HOWEVER. it does not envision the sort of abuse that would maim, or kill a child, BUT rather it promotes discipline that instructs.
original_verse_text: Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the sinful nature that resides in the hearts of children. Grant us wisdom and discernment as we seek to nurture and discipline our little ones, not with harsh or abusive means, but with the loving guidance that Your Word instructs. Help us to cultivate in them a heart that is pure and obedient, that they may grow in the knowledge and fear of the Lord. May our homes be places where Your truth is upheld, and Your love is demonstrated. We ask this in the name of Jesus, our Savior. Amen.
reflection: “Heart of a child,” I think many tend to think of children as morally neutral at worst. But the Bible does not; it says we are born with a sinful nature. Godly education means not merely bringing the child's good talents to light but also driving out the bad. The Bible does approve of corporal punishment. However, it does not envision the sort of abuse that would maim or kill a child, but rather it promotes discipline that instructs.
subject: Cultivate the Child's Heart
verse_text: Folly is bound up in the heart of a child, but the rod of discipline drives it far from him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply your_

_heart to my knowledge, for it will be pleasant if you keep them_

_within you, if all of them are ready on your lips._ (Pro.22:17, 18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon"s primary concern is to teach his readers to trust the Lord.

_"in your heart, on your lips," _This is the Bible's way of both
saying.

both inwardly and outwardly. In other words be able to recite them

and explain the connections between them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me for becoming lax in putting Your Word to

memory. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon"s primary concern is to teach his readers to trust the Lord. "in your heart, on your lips, " This is the Bible's way of both saying. both inwardly and outwardly. In other words be able to recite them and explain the connections between them.
original_verse_text: Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply your heart to my knowledge, for it will be pleasant if you keep them within you, if all of them are ready on your lips.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to trust in You with all our being. Help us to lean not on our own understanding, but to acknowledge You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths. May Your wisdom be ever-present on our lips, that we may speak of Your truth and faithfulness. Guide us, Lord, to walk in Your ways, for Your ways are higher than our own. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Solomon's primary concern is to teach his readers to trust the Lord. “In your heart, on your lips,” This is the Bible's way of both saying, both inwardly and outwardly. In other words, be able to recite them and explain the connections between them.
subject: Trusting the Lord Inwardly and Outwardly
verse_text: Incline your ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply your heart to my knowledge, for it will be pleasant if you keep them within you, if all of them are ready on your lips.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_make no friendship with a man given to anger, nor go _

_with a wrathful man, lest you learn his ways, and entangle_

_yourself in a snare. _(Pro. 22:24, 25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Angry people tend to exploit other; if we associate

with them we learn the think like they do.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, it is my prayer that I would be

sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance so that I would

not fall into the trap of associating with those would

lead me down the path of unrighteousness. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: Angry people tend to exploit other; if we associate with them we learn the think like they do.
original_verse_text: make no friendship with a man given to anger, nor go with a wrathful man, lest you learn his ways, and entangle yourself in a snare.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your guidance and wisdom. Help us to heed the wisdom found in Proverbs, to avoid associating with those who harbor anger and bitterness, lest we too learn to think and act in such a way. Grant us the grace to be kind and compassionate, forgiving one another as You have forgiven us through Christ. May our speech and conduct reflect the love and peace that comes from Your Spirit. We ask this in the name of Jesus, our Lord and Savior. Amen.
reflection: Angry people tend to exploit others; if we associate with them, we learn to think like they do.
subject: Avoid Angry, Exploitative People
verse_text: make no friendship with a man given to anger, nor go with a wrathful man, lest you learn his ways, and entangle yourself in a snare.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Do not speak in the hearing of a fool. for he will despise_

_the good sense of your words. ._(Pro. 23:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Fools only want to hear their own _WISDOM.. _One cannot

directly correct a fool and expect to make any headway.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Spirit will advice

me as to how I should approach those who are less than

approachable. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Fools only want to hear their own WISDOM. One cannot directly correct a fool and expect to make any headway.
original_verse_text: Do not speak in the hearing of a fool. for he will despise the good sense of your words.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to discern when to engage with those who reject Your truth, and when to refrain, lest we be drawn into their foolishness. Grant us the wisdom to speak truth in love, and the patience to wait upon Your timing. May we ever seek to glorify Your name, and not our own. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Fools only want to hear their own wisdom. One cannot directly correct a fool and expect to make any headway.
subject: Wisdom Eludes the Foolish
verse_text: Do not speak in the hearing of a fool. for he will despise the good sense of your words.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice; he who _

_fathers a wise son will be glad in him. _(Pro. 23:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Good parents have reason to rejoice when they see

their children growing wisely. this brings them more

joy than if their children become rich and successful

in school or work.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord Jesus for Your continuing presence

in our lives. I pray that our children and grandchildren

will grow in godly wisdom. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Good parents have reason to rejoice when they see their children growing wisely. this brings them more joy than if their children become rich and successful in school or work.
original_verse_text: The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice; he who fathers a wise son will be glad in him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of children and the joy they bring when they walk in Your ways. May our homes be filled with the wisdom that comes from You, that our children may grow in understanding and honor You in all they do. Help us as parents to guide them with Your truth, that we may rejoice in their godly character more than any earthly success. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Good parents have reason to rejoice when they see their children growing wisely. This brings them more joy than if their children become rich and successful in school or work.
subject: Rejoice in Children's Wise Growth
verse_text: The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice; he who fathers a wise son will be glad in him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If you say, "Behold we did not know this," Does not _

_He who weighs the heart perceive it? _(Pro. 24:12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Remember claiming ignorance will not work with God,

who knows whether or not we saw people in need and

refused to help them. We need to remember that the One

who created us and everything, else knows us through

and through.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord help me to remain faithful through life, willing

to help my neighbor when in need. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Remember claiming ignorance will not work with God, who knows whether or not we saw people in need and refused to help them. We need to remember that the One who created us and everything, else knows us through and through.
original_verse_text: If you say, "Behold we did not know this, " Does not He who weighs the heart perceive it?
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that You know the secrets of our hearts and the motives behind our actions. Forgive us for the times when we have turned a blind eye to the needs of others, claiming ignorance or making excuses. Lord, help us to have eyes that see the hurting and the vulnerable, and a heart that is compelled to respond with compassion and care. May we walk in a manner worthy of the calling we have received, ever mindful that You see all and will judge our deeds. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Remember, claiming ignorance will not work with God, who knows whether or not we saw people in need and refused to help them. We need to remember that the One who created us and everything else knows us through and through.
subject: Ignorance Won't Excuse Inaction
verse_text: If you say, “Behold we did not know this, ” Does not He who weighs the heart perceive it?

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Everything is meaningless," says the teacher, "utterly_

_ meaningless_!"(Ecc 1:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is ironic that so many people spend so much time securing

their lives on earth but take very little or no thought where

they will spend eternity. few people understand that their

only hope is in the Lord.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, please forgive me for focusing

on earthly thing more than on eternal things. Amen.
original_reflection_text: It is ironic that so many people spend so much time securing their lives on earth but take very little or no thought where they will spend eternity. few people understand that their only hope is in the Lord.
original_verse_text: "Everything is meaningless, " says the teacher, "utterly meaningless!"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the fleeting nature of this world and the vanity of our own pursuits. We confess that so often we have been deceived, believing that the ways of this world lead to true fulfillment, when in reality, Your ways alone lead to eternal life. Lord, open our eyes to see the truth of Your Word, that there is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way of death. Draw us ever closer to You, the source of all wisdom and the giver of life everlasting. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: It is ironic that so many people spend so much time securing their lives on earth but take very little or no thought where they will spend eternity. Few people understand that their only hope is in the Lord.
subject: Secure Earthly Life, Neglect Eternity
verse_text: “Everything is meaningless, ” says the teacher, “utterly meaningless!”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Generations come and go, but nothing really changes _

(Ecc. 1:4 )

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Remember God placed the world on its foundation so

it would never be moved. Yes the world is built on God's

foundation and He guarantees its permanence. That same

power that undergirds the world ALSO provides a firm foundation

for believers.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your faithfulness

which extends to all generations, which is also as enduring

as the earth You created. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Remember God placed the world on its foundation so it would never be moved. Yes the world is built on God's foundation and He guarantees its permanence. That same power that undergrads the world ALSO provides a firm foundation for believers.
original_verse_text: Generations come and go, but nothing really changes.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the enduring foundation You have laid for this world. Your power and majesty are everlasting, and Your throne is established from of old. We find our security in You, the Rock that never changes. Help us to trust in Your steadfast love and faithfulness, for our lives are built upon the unshakable truth of Your Word. Amen.
reflection: Remember, God placed the world on its foundation so it would never be moved. Yes, the world is built on God's foundation, and He guarantees its permanence. That same power that undergirds the world also provides a firm foundation for believers.
subject: Unshakable Foundation for Believers
verse_text: Generations come and go, but nothing really changes.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Everything under the sun is meaningless, like chasing the wind._

_What is wronged cannot be made right. what is missing cannot_

_be recovered. _(Ecc. 1:14-15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon tests our faith, challenging us to find true and lasting

meaning in God alone. As you take a hard look at your life, as

Solomon did his, you will see how important serving God is

over all other opinions.Is God asking you to rethink your purpose

and direction in life?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Spirit would help me to

be faithful in always reexamining my thinking and purpose in life.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon tests our faith, challenging us to find true and lasting meaning in God alone. As you take a hard look at your life, as Solomon did his, you will see how important serving God is over all other opinions. Is God asking you to rethink your purpose and direction in life?
original_verse_text: Everything under the sun is meaningless, like chasing the wind. What is wronged cannot be made right. what is missing cannot be recovered.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the fleeting nature of all that this world has to offer. Like Solomon, we have seen the vanity and striving after the wind, and our hearts long for the true and lasting meaning that can only be found in You. Lord, we trust in You with all our hearts, and we lean not on our own understanding. Guide us, we pray, as we seek to align our lives with Your perfect will. May we not rely on our own wisdom, but trust in You to direct our paths. In Your name we pray, Amen.
reflection: Solomon tests our faith, challenging us to find true and lasting meaning in God alone. As you take a hard look at your life, as Solomon did his, you will see how important serving God is over all other opinions. Is God asking you to rethink your purpose and direction in life?
subject: Seek True Meaning in God
verse_text: Everything under the sun is meaningless, like chasing the wind. What is wronged cannot be made right. what is missing cannot be recovered.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Solomon said, "_The greater my wisdom, the greater my grief._

_To increase knowledge only increases sorrow. _(Ecc. 1:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our minds cannot fathom God's wisdom, which is hidden in

Christ. We know His mercy only through the wisdom revealed

to us in Holy Scripture.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O God of all mercies, You have begun good works in us.Continue

we pray, to fill us with all wisdom and knowledge. Grant that

Satan would have no power over us, but that our hearts and minds

might be directed to the blessed hope of the coming of our Savior

Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Our minds cannot fathom God's wisdom, which is hidden in Christ. We know His mercy only through the wisdom revealed to us in Holy Scripture.
original_verse_text: Solomon said, "The greater my wisdom, the greater my grief. To increase knowledge only increases sorrow.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your infinite wisdom, which is beyond our understanding. Your ways are higher than our ways, and Your thoughts are higher than our thoughts. Grant us humility to submit to the wisdom revealed in Your Word, that we may know the depths of Your mercy and grace in Christ Jesus. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: Our minds cannot fathom God's wisdom, which is hidden in Christ. We know His mercy only through the wisdom revealed to us in Holy Scripture.
subject: Unfathomable Wisdom Revealed in Christ
verse_text: Solomon said, “The greater my wisdom, the greater my grief. To increase knowledge only increases sorrow.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Solomon said to himself, "Come now, let's give pleasure_

_a try. Let's look for the good things in life. but I found that_

_this, too, was meaningless. _(Ecc. 2:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon's goal was to explore what life might be for the

ideally gifted and advantaged, but it was meaningless, We

should not try to find enjoyment in happiness, goods, our

own counsels, or any other thing; only as God has given

them should we use them. One should let God have His way.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, Help me to be observant of the mistakes of others

and give me the wisdom to not make the same mistakes. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon's goal was to explore what life might be for the ideally gifted and advantaged, but it was meaningless, We should not try to find enjoyment in happiness, goods, our own counsels, or any other thing; only as God has given them should we use them. One should let God have His way.
original_verse_text: Solomon said to himself, "Come now, let's give pleasure a try. Let's look for the good things in life. but I found that this, too, was meaningless.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that true wisdom and understanding come not from our own pursuits, but from Your gracious hand. Help us to see that the pursuit of happiness and material gain apart from You is ultimately meaningless. May we find our joy and contentment in walking according to Your will, trusting that Your ways are higher and better than our own. Guide us, Lord, to use the blessings You have given us for Your glory, not our own selfish gain. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Solomon's goal was to explore what life might be for the ideally gifted and advantaged, but it was meaningless. We should not try to find enjoyment in happiness, goods, our own counsels, or any other thing; only as God has given them should we use them. One should let God have His way.
subject: Embrace God's Gifts, Not Worldly Pursuits
verse_text: Solomon said to himself, “Come now, let's give pleasure a try. Let's look for the good things in life. but I found that this, too, was meaningless.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Solomon says, "Then I saw that there is more gain in wisdom_

_than in folly, as there is more gain in light then in darkness._

_the wise person has his eyes in his head, but the fool walks in _

_darkness. And yet I perceived the same event happens to them _

_all. _(Ecc. 2:13-14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Rich and poor have one similarity; when they die they will

leave all they own behind. At the moment of death (which every

one will face) both rich and poor are naked and empty handed and

will face the Lord.. The only riches have at that time are those we

have already invested in, our eternal heritage.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I know that one day I will stand before You

empty handed. I pray that at that time I will have attained eternal

life through faith in our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Rich and poor have one similarity; when they die they will leave all they own behind. At the moment of death (which every one will face) both rich and poor are naked and empty handed and will face the Lord. The only riches have at that time are those we have already invested in, our eternal heritage.
original_verse_text: Solomon says, "Then I saw that there is more gain in wisdom than in folly, as there is more gain in light then in darkness. the wise person has his eyes in his head, but the fool walks in darkness. And yet I perceived the same event happens to them all.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that all our earthly possessions and wealth will one day be left behind. In the face of death, we are all equal, stripped of our material comforts and standing naked before Your sovereign gaze. Help us to recognize that the only true riches we can take with us are those we have invested in our eternal heritage through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we live with this understanding, storing up treasures in heaven that will last forever. Amen.
reflection: Rich and poor have one similarity; when they die, they will leave all they own behind. At the moment of death (which everyone will face), both rich and poor are naked and empty-handed and will face the Lord. The only riches we have at that time are those we have already invested in, our eternal heritage.
subject: Eternal Riches Await All
verse_text: Solomon says, “Then I saw that there is more gain in wisdom than in folly, as there is more gain in light then in darkness. the wise person has his eyes in his head, but the fool walks in darkness. And yet I perceived the same event happens to them all.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Solomon after examining his life says, "_So I turned in despair_

_from hard work , it was not the answer to my search for
satisfaction_

_in this life." _(Ecc. 2:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon's point is that God has a plan for all people. God provides

cycles of life, each with it's work for us to do. Although we may
face

many problems that seem to contradict God's plan, these should not

be barriers to believing in Him but rather opportunities to discover

that without God, life's problems have no lasting solutions.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, what would we be if You were to forsake us,

if You withdrew Your Word and Your hand? Enlighten us with Your

Word. Let us walk in the light of Your blessed Son, our Lord Jesus

Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon's point is that God has a plan for all people. God provides cycles of life, each with it's work for us to do. Although we may face many problems that seem to contradict God's plan, these should not be barriers to believing in Him but rather opportunities to discover that without God, life's problems have no lasting solutions.
original_verse_text: Solomon after examining his life says, "So I turned in despair from hard work, it was not the answer to my search for satisfaction in this life. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the fleeting nature of our earthly pursuits and the wisdom of Your eternal plan. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts, and not lean on our own understanding, but to acknowledge You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths. When we are tempted to despair over the problems and challenges of life, remind us that Your ways are higher than our ways, and that You have a purpose for all things. May we find rest and peace in the assurance of Your sovereign will. Amen.
reflection: Solomon's point is that God has a plan for all people. God provides cycles of life, each with its work for us to do. Although we may face many problems that seem to contradict God's plan, these should not be barriers to believing in Him but rather opportunities to discover that without God, life's problems have no lasting solutions.
subject: Discover God's Plan in Life's Cycles
verse_text: Solomon after examining his life says, “So I turned in despair from hard work, it was not the answer to my search for satisfaction in this life. ”

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_God gives wisdom, knowledge, and joy to those who please Him._

(Ecc. 2:26a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Those who really know how to enjoy life are the ones who take

life each day as a gift from God, thanking Him for it.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, You have given us many priceless gifts.

by Your gracious hand, I thank you in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Those who really know how to enjoy life are the ones who take life each day as a gift from God, thanking Him for it.
original_verse_text: God gives wisdom, knowledge, and joy to those who please Him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that every day is a precious gift from Your hand. Help us to see each moment as an opportunity to delight in Your creation and to live in the joy of Your presence, as Your word in Psalm 118:24 instructs us. Grant us the wisdom to use our time and talents in ways that honor You, for it is You who gives to the one who pleases You, as Ecclesiastes 2:26 reminds us. May our lives be a reflection of Your goodness and grace. Amen.
reflection: Those who really know how to enjoy life are the ones who take life each day as a gift from God, thanking Him for it.
subject: Embrace Life's Daily Gifts
verse_text: God gives wisdom, knowledge, and joy to those who please Him.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_For everything there is a season, and a time for every_

_matter under the sun._ (Ecc. 3:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

All human works and efforts have a certain and definite time

of acting, of beginning, and ending, beyond human control.

this is spoken in opposition to free will. it is not up to us to

prescribe the time, the manner, or the effect of the things that

are to be done; and so it is obvious that here our strivings and

efforts are unreliable.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father. I pray that I would always follow

Your guidance. May I always be found faithful in what

ever You ask me to do. Amen.
original_reflection_text: All human works and efforts have a certain and definite time of acting, of beginning, and ending, beyond human control. this is spoken in opposition to free will. it is not up to us to prescribe the time, the manner, or the effect of the things that are to be done; and so it is obvious that here our striving and efforts are unreliable.
original_verse_text: For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under the sun.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that our plans and efforts are not always in alignment with Your perfect timing and will. Help us to trust in Your sovereign control over the events and circumstances of our lives. Grant us the wisdom to discern Your leading, and the humility to submit our ways to Yours. May we find peace in the knowledge that our steps are ultimately ordered by Your hand. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: All human works and efforts have a certain and definite time of acting, of beginning, and ending, beyond human control. This is spoken in opposition to free will. It is not up to us to prescribe the time, the manner, or the effect of the things that are to be done; and so it is obvious that here our striving and efforts are unreliable.
subject: Timing of Human Endeavors
verse_text: For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under the sun.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant and a_

_time to pluck up what was planted; _(Ecc. 3:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_born. die _as we think about these appointed times it

seems painfully short to us. To _plant _and_ pluck_ are as

short as an agricultural season A wise person should grasp

these rhythms of life and live in agreement with them because

these are the allotted times our Lord has placed us in.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would, by Your Holy Spirit's

guidance fulfill these time slots in accordance with Your will. .

Amen.
original_reflection_text: born. die as we think about these appointed times it seems painfully short to us. To plant and pluck are as short as an agricultural season A wise person should grasp these rhythms of life and live in agreement with them because these are the allotted times our Lord has placed us in.
original_verse_text: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant and a time to pluck up what was planted;
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that our days on this earth are but a fleeting moment, as Ecclesiastes 3:2 reminds us. Help us to number our days, as Psalm 90:12 instructs, that we may gain a heart of wisdom. Grant us the discernment to live in harmony with the rhythms and seasons You have ordained, embracing the times to plant and the times to pluck up. May we make the most of the allotted time You have given us, seeking to honor You in all we do. Amen.
reflection: Born, die as we think about these appointed times, it seems painfully short to us. To plant and pluck are as short as an agricultural season. A wise person should grasp these rhythms of life and live in agreement with them because these are the allotted times our Lord has placed us in.
subject: Rhythms of Life's Seasons
verse_text: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant and a time to pluck up what was planted;

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

(Ecc. 3:3) says: _There is a time to kill, and a time to heal;_

_a time to break down, and a time to build up;_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The term here is applied to those in earthly positions of

authority who are to serve God and people. God allows

governments to us the death penalty.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord, for caring for us through those you have

put in authority over us. Guide them to use their authority

according to Your will, and help us to obey them. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The term here is applied to those in earthly positions of authority who are to serve God and people. God allows governments to us the death penalty.
original_verse_text: There is a time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that all authority comes from You and that You have established the governing authorities for our good. Help us to submit to them with respect and obedience, even when we disagree with their decisions. Grant wisdom to our leaders, that they may use their power justly and with compassion, always seeking to uphold Your righteous standards. We trust in Your sovereign plan, even when we cannot fully understand it. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The term here is applied to those in earthly positions of authority who are to serve God and people. God allows governments to use the death penalty.
subject: Earthly Authorities Serve God
verse_text: There is a time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Ec. 3:4 says: _There is a time to weep, and a time to laugh;_

_a time to mourn, and a time to dance._

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus says in His Sermon on the Mount,_ to live in harmony_

_with one another; He says, rejoice with those who rejoice, and_

_weep with those who weep._

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, Help me to be the best neighbor I can be, help me

see the needs of others. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Jesus says in His Sermon on the Mount, to live in harmony with one another; He says, rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep.
original_verse_text: There is a time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the truth that there is a time for every matter under heaven. In this world, we are called to live in harmony, to rejoice with those who rejoice and to weep with those who weep. Lord, grant us the wisdom and compassion to walk alongside one another, to share in each other's joys and sorrows, and to be a reflection of Your love and grace. May our lives be a testament to the unity and fellowship that You desire for Your people. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: Jesus says in His Sermon on the Mount to live in harmony with one another. He says, “Rejoice with those who rejoice, and weep with those who weep.”
subject: Rejoice and Weep Together
verse_text: There is a time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_There is a time to scatter stones and a time to gather stones._

_A time to embrace and a time to turn away. _(Ec. 3:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon's point of view in these verses is that God has a

plan for all people. In doing this he shows us that God

provides numerous cycles in life, each with its work for us

to do. Although we may face many problems that seem to

contradict God's plan,these should not be barriers to believe

in Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Help me to understand that without You, lives opportunities have

no lasting solutions. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon's point of view in these verses is that God has a plan for all people. In doing this he shows us that God provides numerous cycles in life, each with its work for us to do. Although we may face many problems that seem to contradict God's plan, these should not be barriers to believe in Him.
original_verse_text: There is a time to scatter stones and a time to gather stones. A time to embrace and a time to turn away.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that Your ways are higher than our ways. As Proverbs 16:9 reminds us, it is You who directs our steps, even when the path seems unclear. Help us to trust in Your perfect timing, knowing that there is a season for every activity under heaven, as Ecclesiastes 3:5 declares. Grant us the wisdom to discern Your will and the courage to follow where You lead, even when the way is uncertain. May we find peace in the knowledge that Your plan is good, and that You are always working for our ultimate good. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Solomon's point of view in these verses is that God has a plan for all people. In doing this, he shows us that God provides numerous cycles in life, each with its work for us to do. Although we may face many problems that seem to contradict God's plan, these should not be barriers to believing in Him.
subject: Embracing God's Purposeful Cycles
verse_text: There is a time to scatter stones and a time to gather stones. A time to embrace and a time to turn away.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_There is a time to search and a time to lose; a time_

_to keep and a time to throw away. _(Ec. 3:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Timing is important. All the experiences listed in these verses

are appropriate at certain times. the secret to peace with God

is to discover, accept, and appreciate God's perfect timing.

The danger is to doubt or resent God's timing. This can lead

to despair, rebellion, or moving ahead without His advice.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that when I become impatient

You will rein me in so that I will not run out ahead of You,

thus falling into despair. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Timing is important. All the experiences listed in these verses are appropriate at certain times. the secret to peace with God is to discover, accept, and appreciate God's perfect timing. The danger is to doubt or resent God's timing. This can lead to despair, rebellion, or moving ahead without His advice.
original_verse_text: There is a time to search and a time to lose; a time to keep and a time to throw away.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that the times and seasons of our lives are in Your hands. Help us to trust in Your perfect timing, even when it differs from our own desires and expectations. Grant us the wisdom to discern Your will and the patience to wait upon Your guidance. May we find peace in the knowledge that our lives are secure in Your loving care. We surrender our plans to You, trusting that Your timing is always right. Amen.
reflection: Timing is important. All the experiences listed in these verses are appropriate at certain times. the secret to peace with God is to discover, accept, and appreciate God's perfect timing. The danger is to doubt or resent God's timing. This can lead to despair, rebellion, or moving ahead without His advice.
subject: Embrace God's Perfect Timing
verse_text: There is a time to search and a time to lose; a time to keep and a time to throw away.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_There is a time to tear, and a time to sew: a time to_

_ keep silent, and a time to speak. _(Ec. 3:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

tear. sew. A time to undo what we have done and a time to

repair what we have undone. _silence. speak_ -- Slow to speak -quick to listen. A time to be silent when words violate the Eight

Commandment, and a time to speak the healing words of God.

The time for changes should be discretely weighed, as to when

the tongue ought to be restrained, or when it might speak the

wonderful words of comfort.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray for the wisdom to weigh my words carefully

so that I have the words You would have me to share to one

who may be hurting from careless words that may have been

spoken by another. Amen.
original_reflection_text: tear. sew. A time to undo what we have done and a time to repair what we have undone. silence. speak -- Slow to speak -quick to listen. A time to be silent when words violate the Eight Commandment, and a time to speak the healing words of God. The time for changes should be discretely weighed, as to when the tongue ought to be restrained, or when it might speak the wonderful words of comfort.
original_verse_text: There is a time to tear, and a time to sew: a time to keep silent, and a time to speak.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the wisdom in Your Word. Grant us discernment to know when to be silent and when to speak, that our words may honor You and build up our neighbor. May we be quick to listen and slow to speak, guarding our tongues against any violation of Your commandments. In times of change and transition, steady our hearts and guide our speech, that we may offer the healing balm of Your comfort. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: tear. sew. A time to undo what we have done and a time to repair what we have undone. Silence. Speak -- Slow to speak, quick to listen. A time to be silent when words violate the Eighth Commandment, and a time to speak the healing words of God. The time for changes should be discreetly weighed, as to when the tongue ought to be restrained, or when it might speak the wonderful words of comfort.
subject: Tear, Sew: a Time for Change
verse_text: There is a time to tear, and a time to sew: a time to keep silent, and a time to speak.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

There is: _A time to love and a time to hate. a time_

_for war and a time for peace. _(Ec. 3:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When is there a time for hating? We shouldn't hate evil

people, but we should hate what they do. We should also

hate it when people are mistreated, when children are

starving, and when God is dishonored. In addition, we

must hate sin in our life BECAUSE this is God's attitude!

(Ps. 5:5)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit

would Help me to be aware of the sins in my life that

so often seem to cause me to drift from the path You

would have me follow. Amen.
original_reflection_text: When is there a time for hating? We shouldn't hate evil people, but we should hate what they do. We should also hate it when people are mistreated, when children are starving, and when God is dishonored. In addition, we must hate sin in our life BECAUSE this is God's attitude! (Psalm 5:5)
original_verse_text: There is: A time to love and a time to hate. a time for war and a time for peace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to discern the times when we should hate, not out of malice, but out of a righteous desire to stand against the evils that plague our world. Grant us the courage to hate what is wicked and to love what is good, that we may honor You in all we do. May our lives reflect Your holy standards, and may we be steadfast in our opposition to sin and injustice. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: When is there a time for hating? We shouldn't hate evil people, but we should hate what they do. We should also hate it when people are mistreated, when children are starving, and when God is dishonored. In addition, we must hate sin in our life because this is God's attitude! (Psalm 5:5)
subject: Hate What is Evil
verse_text: There is: A time to love and a time to hate. a time for war and a time for peace.
